Example

Firstly export a blueprint to JSON format in which to use as base policy & settings template in which to base the newly created one.

  • Create a new IaaS blueprint within the vRA Portal or select an existing one [vra iaas blueprint list]
  • Export the blueprint to a file[vra iaas blueprint detail --name "My Dev Blueprint" --export blueprint.json"]
  • You can edit blueprint.json and make any required changes.

If you want to change the provisioning workflow to be altered modify the WorkflowId property to WorkflowName & provide a valid workflow, ie: "CloneWorkflow". This can be good for exporting from one vRA Server to another.

Create a new template with [vra iaas blueprints vsphere add --inputfile blueprint.json --name "My Dev Blueprint 2" --cpu 4 --memory 2048 --servicename Infrastructure --description "My Dev Blueprint 2"]

If you provide --clonefrom parameter CloudClient will validate this machine exists within vRA
